metadata.title: CVE-2020-36785 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:atomisp: Fix use after free in atomisp_alloc_css_stat_bufs() The "s3a_buf"is freed along with all the other items on the "asd->s3a_stats" list. Itleads to a double free and a use after free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36785` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
